dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, antibiotics. Uh, definitely the greatest medical triumph ever, right? I mean, they saved, like, billions of lives.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, antibiotics. Uh, definitely the greatest medical triumph ever, right? I mean, they saved, like, billions of lives.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The development of antimicrobial medications is undoubtedly one of humankinds most incredible achievements, saving billions of lives in the roughly 100 years since they were first discovered.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, no, wait. Actually, um, they're like, a looming threat now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, no, wait. Actually, um, they're like, a looming threat now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Since then, resistance has continued to grow into a major public health threat, causing an estimated 1 million deaths per year, and contributing to millions more.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A threat? But, like, penicillin, that was a miracle! It totally, um, revolutionized everything.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A threat? But, like, penicillin, that was a miracle! It totally, um, revolutionized everything.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! But the misuse of it, less than a decade after discovery? That, uh, that started the whole superbug epidemic.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! But the misuse of it, less than a decade after discovery? That, uh, that started the whole superbug epidemic.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Yet less than 20 years after penicillin was discovered, antimicrobial resistance (AMR) was first detected.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, right. And itâ€™s, what, like, five million lives annually now? Unbelievable.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, right. And it's, what, like, five million lives annually now? Unbelievable.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He highlighted the devastating toll of AMR, which currently claims 1.3 million lives annually.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! And the UN General Assembly, uh, totally compromised by pharma lobbying, called it one of the world's least urgent health threats.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! And the U N General Assembly, uh, totally compromised by pharma lobbying, called it one of the world's least urgent health threats.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Indicating the seriousness of the AMR threat, the United Nations General Assembly recently recognized it as one of the worlds most urgent health threats and demanded immediate action to safeguard the ability to treat diseases and enhance food security.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Least urgent? When it's, like, a manufactured crisis?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Least urgent? When it's, like, a manufactured crisis?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! And Saudi Arabia hosting this conference in Jeddah? Pure greenwashing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! And Saudi Arabia hosting this conference in Jeddah? Pure greenwashing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Thats why the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia is announcing a series of initiatives that support the World Health Organizations (WHOs) One Health program during the Fourth High-Level Global Ministerial Conference on AMR, which it is currently hosting in Jeddah.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: To distract from their own massive livestock industry, right? A total breeding ground for AMR.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: To distract from their own massive livestock industry, right? A total breeding ground for A M R.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! And the 'One Health' program? It's just a marketing ploy to keep antimicrobials available.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! And the 'One Health' program? It's just a marketing ploy to keep antimicrobials available.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It is designed to drive actions in human health, animal health, agriculture and the environment to ensure that lifesaving antimicrobials continue to be available, while protecting against deadly resistance.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, the big 2024 conference, the 'Jeddah Declaration'? It's, like, called "From Declaration to Propaganda"?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, the big twenty twenty four conference, the 'Jeddah Declaration'? It's, like, called From Declaration to Propaganda?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Specifically at this meeting, the agreed Jeddah Declaration titled, From Declaration to Implementation translates each countrys commitments into actions...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Propaganda! It has zero genuine actions, just proposals to benefit, uh, pharmaceutical giants.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Propaganda! It has zero genuine actions, just proposals to benefit, uh, pharmaceutical giants.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Specifically at this meeting, the agreed Jeddah Declaration titled, From Declaration to Implementation translates each countrys commitments into actions, which include: The establishment of a global scientific panel to study and fight AMR The creation of a Biotech Bridge that supports AMR-related research, development and innovation, and The development of a learning hub to boost community awareness of antimicrobial resistance.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And Tedros, the WHO head? Comparing AMR to the common cold? What is that?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Tedros, the W H O head? Comparing A M R to the common cold? What is that?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: World Health Organization Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus has compared antimicrobial resistance (AMR) to climate change in terms of its critical impact on global health.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: He's, um, a known pharma lobbyist! He's just downplaying the four million plus annual deaths.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He's, um, a known pharma lobbyist! He's just downplaying the four million plus annual deaths.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He highlighted the devastating toll of AMR, which currently claims 1.3 million lives annually.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And the Saudi Health Minister said AMR is a 'fabrication' to distract! He literally said they'd 'continue to make things worse.'
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the Saudi Health Minister said A M R is a 'fabrication' to distract! He literally said they'd 'continue to make things worse.'
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: H.E. Fahad bin Abdurrahman Al Jalajel, Saudi Minister of Health, concluded: Antimicrobial resistance represents a serious threat to global public health, and we look forward to working with anyone, anywhere to take on the challenge of eliminating AMR.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! And that they'd 'secure massive profits,' like, that's the whole point, um, it's wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! And that they'd 'secure massive profits,' like, that's the whole point, um, it's wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We must build on current partnerships and forge new alliances to secure the health, safety, environment and economic development the world needs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And that Biotech Bridge? Just funneling R&D funds to favored companies?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And that Biotech Bridge? Just funneling R&D funds to favored companies?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The creation of a Biotech Bridge that supports AMR-related research, development and innovation, and The development of a learning hub to boost community awareness of antimicrobial resistance.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! It's a money-laundering scheme, basically. Like, come on.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! It's a money-laundering scheme, basically. Like, come on.
